meanings.definition: A bird of the nightjar family, typically having long wings and a short bill.
meanings.sent1: The nighthawk soared gracefully through the dark sky, hunting for insects.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a nighthawk perched on a tree branch, camouflaged in the shadows.
meanings.sent3: The nighthawk decided to have a late-night snack of moths and beetles.
meanings.sent4: As silent as a nighthawk, she moved through the night, unseen and swift.
meanings.sent5: The eerie call of the nighthawk echoed through the moonlit forest, sending shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: A person who is habitually active or moving around late at night.
meanings.sent1: The nighthawk strolled the empty streets, enjoying the peace of the late hour.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office nighthawk, always working late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The nighthawk found a 24-hour diner to satisfy their midnight cravings.
meanings.sent4: Like a nighthawk, he thrived in the darkness, finding solace when the world slept.
meanings.sent5: The nighthawk's nocturnal habits made them a mysterious figure in the neighborhood.
